availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Matthew C. Givens (Hopkins County, KY, farmer and attorney )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer and attorney. Kentucky native. Son of James K. Givens and Elizabeth R. Givens. Married to Catherine H. Givens. Father of Duncan C. Givens. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eleven enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Attorney in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 67B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 692.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 704.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 215A.
